techmeme.title: A profile of Mark Gubrud, who coined the term AGI in a 1997 research paper, which argued that breakthrough technologies will redefine international conflicts (Steven Levy/Wired)
Cologne-based Octonomy, which helps companies deploy AI in complex workflows, raised a $20M seed led by Macquarie Capital, bringing its total raised to $25M (Amelia Isaacs/Pathfounders)
Sources: Pony AI plans to raise $863M in its November 6 Hong Kong IPO by selling 48.3M shares at ~$17.88 each, below its October 31 Nasdaq close at $18.68 (Bloomberg)
During an interview, Satya Nadella says Microsoft faces a power shortage, not a compute one, which could leave "chips sitting in inventory that I can't plug in" (Jowi Morales/Tom's Hardware)
Baidu says its Apollo Go robotaxi hit 250,000 weekly orders globally as of October 31, matching Waymo's 250,000 weekly paid US rides reported in April 2025 (Evelyn Cheng/CNBC)
